name: 5.24 "Cheers: The Motion Picture" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who did Woody's dad talk to about Boston?
questions.explanation:
Uncle Fergy.

	Uncle Fergy said he was mugged four times while in Boston. As a result, Woody's parents believed that Boston was too dangerous for their son to live in.

questions.text: How many times had Woody been mugged since moving to Boston?
questions.explanation:
10.

	The gang is surprised when Woody says how many times he has been mugged. However, this did not phase Woody in the least.

questions.text: Diane told them "stick to the script", but be what?
questions.explanation:
Spontaneous.

	Diane was driving everyone crazy with her orders. They eventually fired her as director of the movie.

questions.text: What can't Sam find on the camcorder?
questions.explanation:
the on button.

	Diane thinks they'd never be able to make a movie without her. Sam helps prove this thought when he says he can't even find the 'on' button. However, they do end up making a film, and Diane does end up helping in the end.

Tom.

	Woody's brother was only mentioned, never seen. Woody occasionally talked about members of his family and life in Hanover, Indiana.

questions.text: What was Sam reading in the movie?
questions.explanation:
The "Bible".

	He said he was reading the "Book of Galatians". Sam was not a reader, but they had him reading the "Bible" in the film to make him look good to Woody's parents.

questions.text: When Woody told Carla to say something besides "Hi", what did she say?
questions.explanation:
"Hello".

	Carla became camera shy and couldn't speak. This was unusual for Carla who always had something to say.

questions.text: Did Woody deliver the mail for Cliff?
questions.explanation:
no.

	Cliff asked Woody to deliver some of his mail, but Woody said he couldn't because he wasn't a postal worker. Cliff said he was testing Woody, and Woody passed the test.

questions.text: What did Woody say the best restaurant in Boston was?
questions.explanation:
The Hungry Heifer.

	This was during the scene in the movie with Norm. Norm loved the Hungry Heifer and brought Woody there. He ordered a meal for two, so Woody thought it was for him as well, but it was only for Norm.

questions.text: Who ultimately made it possible for Woody to stay in Boston?
questions.explanation:
Al.

	Al was played by Al Rosen. He was a regular guest star on "Cheers" up until his death in 1990. He basically told Woody's parents to trust his son and he wouldn't let them down.
